news.title: US and Ukraine signal peace plan progress after Geneva talks
news.summary: Both sides say "intensive work" will take place on outstanding issues following talks on a US-backed plan to end the war.

news.title: Boy with rare condition amazes doctors after world-first gene therapy
news.summary: Oliver has an inherited condition called Hunter syndrome, which causes progressive damage to the body and brain.

news.title: What can nervous businesses expect from the Budget?
news.summary: It is going to be a nail-biting final few days for business leaders, says the BBC's Business Editor, Simon Jack.

news.title: Lord Cameron reveals he had prostate cancer
news.summary: The former PM is calling for more men to be screened for the disease, which is the most common cancer in males in the UK.

news.title: MPs to question senior BBC figures after resignations and Trump row
news.summary: A former adviser, whose memo sparked resignations from the BBC's director general and head of news, will take questions publicly for the first time.

news.title: Catherine calls for end to 'stigma' around addiction
news.summary: The message from the Princess of Wales comes on Addiction Awareness Week.

news.title: Skye Gyngell, Australia's first female chef to win a Michelin star, dies
news.summary: Skye Gyngell, a former private chef to Nigella Lawson and Madonna, was diagnosed with skin cancer last year.

news.title: UK now world's most expensive place to develop nuclear power, report finds
news.summary: Experts criticised “overly complex” rules and called for an overhaul of Britain's nuclear strategy.

news.title: Actress Cate Blanchett among BBC Radio 4 festive guest editors
news.summary: The Christmas line-up also includes former PM Baroness Theresa May and inventor Sir James Dyson.

news.title: Hunting down those who kill people to sell their body parts for 'magic charms'
news.summary: BBC Africa Eye uncovers two so-called "juju" practitioners, who offer to obtain body parts for ritual purposes.
